Instruction: Boil the potatoes in water until they are tender in the center when pierced with a fork, about 20 minutes. Drain, return the potatoes to the pot, and let them dry out completely over the residual heat.
Use a potato masher to achieve a smooth consistency.
Combine warm mashed potatoes with flour, melted butter, and salt in a medium bowl. Mix gently until a dough forms.
Gently knead the dough on a floured surface. It will be sticky. Roll out with a floured rolling pin into a 9-inch circle, approximately 1/4 inch thick. Cut into quarters using a floured knife.
Cook the farls in a skillet with a sprinkle of flour until both sides are evenly browned, for about 3 minutes per side. Season with salt and serve hot.
